page.title: 01THE AREA GWITHIAN-CAMBORNE
page.content: The area surveyed is mainly rural and lies between the largest population centre in Cornwall(Camborne-Redruth) and the cliffs of the North Coast. It is a hilly area with slopes facing in all directions and very largely consists of medium size farms(200 acres approx). These farms are mainly given over to the production of crops or intensively managed grassland. The climate,though mild,is very windy and wet in winter.Most people in the area live in isolated communities or farms and so the area is lacking in amenities.A visit to a population centre like Camborne or Truro is essential to shop or seek entertainment or company. Not being on the coast,the area is less popular with tourists and does not become so congested as many parts of Cornwall.
